Title.evidence: A Cluster Randomised Controlled Trial of the Modified Hospital Elder Life Program in Reducing Delirium and Length of Stay in Older Patients Undergoing Abdominal Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This cluster randomised controlled trial was conducted at a 2000-bed urban medical center in Taipei, Taiwan, from August 1, 2009, to October 31, 2012.

Participants.evidence: Participants were older patients (≥65 years) undergoing elective gastrectomy, pancreaticoduodenectomy, or colectomy with an expected LOS longer than 6 days.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were cluster randomised by room to receive either the modified Hospital Elder Life Program (mHELP) or usual care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the presence of delirium, assessed daily using the Confusion Assessment Method by blinded nurses.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were cluster randomised by room

Blinding.evidence: assessed daily using the Confusion Assessment Method by blinded nurses

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 577 eligible patients, 377 were randomised (197 to mHELP, 180 to control).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 577 eligible patients, 377 were randomised (197 to mHELP, 180 to control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Delirium occurred in 6.6% of mHELP participants versus 15.1% of controls, with a relative risk of 0.44 (95% CI, 0.23–0.83; P = .008).
